verses.text: \w Remember|strong="H2142"\w* now thy \w Creator|strong="H1254"\w* in the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of thy \w youth|strong="H0979"\w*, while the \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w* not, nor the \w years|strong="H8141"\w* draw \w nigh|strong="H5060"\w*, when thou shalt \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, I have no \w pleasure|strong="H2656"\w* in them;

While the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, or the \w light|strong="H0216"\w*, or the \w moon|strong="H3394"\w*, or the \w stars|strong="H3556"\w*, be not \w darkened|strong="H2821"\w*, nor the \w clouds|strong="H5645"\w* \w return|strong="H7725"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* the \w rain|strong="H1653"\w*:

In the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* when the \w keepers|strong="H8104"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* shall \w tremble|strong="H2111"\w*, and the \w strong|strong="H2428"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* shall \w bow|strong="H5791"\w* themselves, and the \w grinders|strong="H2912"\w* \w cease|strong="H0988"\w* because they are \w few|strong="H4591"\w*, and those that look \w out|strong="H7200"\w* of the \w windows|strong="H0699"\w* be \w darkened|strong="H2821"\w*,\f + \fr 12.3 \ft the grinders…: or, the grinders fail, because they grind little\f*

And the \w doors|strong="H1817"\w* shall be \w shut|strong="H5462"\w* in the \w streets|strong="H7784"\w*, when the \w sound|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w grinding|strong="H2913"\w* is \w low|strong="H8217"\w*, and he shall rise \w up|strong="H6965"\w* at the \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w bird|strong="H6833"\w*, and all the \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* of \w musick|strong="H7892"\w* shall be brought \w low|strong="H7817"\w*;

Also \add when\add* they shall be \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* of \add that which is\add* \w high|strong="H1364"\w*, and \w fears|strong="H2849"\w* \add shall be\add* in the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, and the almond \w tree|strong="H8247"\w* shall \w flourish|strong="H5006"\w*, and the \w grasshopper|strong="H2284"\w* shall be a \w burden|strong="H5445"\w*, and \w desire|strong="H0035"\w* shall \w fail|strong="H6565"\w*: because \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \w goeth|strong="H1980"\w* to his \w long|strong="H5769"\w* \w home|strong="H1004"\w*, and the \w mourners|strong="H5594"\w* go \w about|strong="H5437"\w* the \w streets|strong="H7784"\w*:

Or \w ever|strong="H3808"\w* the \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* \w cord|strong="H2256"\w* be \w loosed|strong="H7576"\w*, or the \w golden|strong="H2091"\w* \w bowl|strong="H1543"\w* be \w broken|strong="H7533"\w*, or the \w pitcher|strong="H3537"\w* be \w broken|strong="H7665"\w* at the \w fountain|strong="H4002"\w*, or the \w wheel|strong="H1534"\w* \w broken|strong="H7533"\w* at the \w cistern|strong="H0953"\w*.

Then shall the \w dust|strong="H6083"\w* \w return|strong="H7725"\w* to the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* as it was: and the \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* shall \w return|strong="H7725"\w* unto \w God|strong="H0430"\w* who \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* it.
¶ \w Vanity|strong="H1892"\w* of \w vanities|strong="H1892"\w*, \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \w preacher|strong="H6953"\w*; all \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*.

And \w moreover|strong="H3148"\w*, because the \w preacher|strong="H6953"\w* was \w wise|strong="H2450"\w*, he still \w taught|strong="H3925"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*; yea, he gave good \w heed|strong="H0239"\w*, and sought \w out|strong="H2713"\w*, \add and\add* set in \w order|strong="H8626"\w* \w many|strong="H7235"\w* \w proverbs|strong="H4912"\w*.\f + \fr 12.9 \ft moreover…: or, the more wise the preacher was, etc\f*

The \w preacher|strong="H6953"\w* \w sought|strong="H1245"\w* to find \w out|strong="H4672"\w* \w acceptable|strong="H2656"\w* \w words|strong="H1697"\w*: and \add that which was\add* \w written|strong="H3789"\w* \add was\add* \w upright|strong="H3476"\w*, \add even\add* \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of \w truth|strong="H0571"\w*.\f + \fr 12.10 \ft acceptable…: Heb. words of delight\f*

The \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add are\add* as \w goads|strong="H1861"\w*, and as \w nails|strong="H4930"\w* \w fastened|strong="H5193"\w* \add by\add* the \w masters|strong="H1167"\w* of \w assemblies|strong="H0627"\w*, \add which\add* are \w given|strong="H5414"\w* from \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w shepherd|strong="H7462"\w*.

And \w further|strong="H3148"\w*, by \w these|strong="H1992"\w*, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, be \w admonished|strong="H2094"\w*: of \w making|strong="H6213"\w* \w many|strong="H7235"\w* \w books|strong="H5612"\w* \add there is\add* no \w end|strong="H7093"\w*; and \w much|strong="H7235"\w* \w study|strong="H3854"\w* \add is\add* a \w weariness|strong="H3024"\w* of the \w flesh|strong="H1320"\w*.\f + \fr 12.12 \ft study: or, reading\f*

¶ Let us \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* the \w conclusion|strong="H5490"\w* of the whole \w matter|strong="H1697"\w*: \w Fear|strong="H3372"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, and \w keep|strong="H8104"\w* his \w commandments|strong="H4687"\w*: for this \add is\add* the whole \add duty\add* of \w man|strong="H0120"\w*.\f + \fr 12.13 \ft Let…: or, The end of the matter, even all that hath been heard, is\f*

For \w God|strong="H0430"\w* shall \w bring|strong="H0935"\w* every \w work|strong="H4639"\w* into \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*, with every secret \w thing|strong="H5956"\w*, whether \add it be\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w*, or whether \add it be\add* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w*.
